alert.note: Alert for Pushmataha (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 3:26PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Pushmataha and southeastern Le Flore Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 325 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 2 miles north of Big Cedar to 9 miles southeast of Nashoba. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Octavia... Muse... Big Cedar... Honobia... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for southeastern Oklahoma.
